summary.p: Clone Explorer provides you with an organized view of your files as well as rolled-up clone metrics such as Clone Percentage. A toolbar associated with this window offers commands to start and stop Clone Detective as well as importing a Clone Detective result file.
To access Clone Explorer, select Clone Explorer on the View - Other Windows menu.

section.title: Toolbar Icons
section.p: Clone Explorer has a toolbar that offers several commands:

tr.td: Icon
Name
Description
Run Clone Detective
Starts clone detection.
Stop Clone Detective
Stops clone detection.
Edit Solution Settings
Allows customizing Solution Settings.
Import Clone Detective Results
Imports a clone detection result file produced by another run, e.g. a nightly build.
Export Clone Detective Results
Exports a clone detection result file to an XML file.
Close Clone Detective Results
Unloads current clone detective results. To load the results again, please click "Run Clone Detective".

section.title: Rollup Metrics
section.p: Clone Explorer offers several different metrics that can be shown for files. They are automatically recursively rolled up to their parent directories. The following table lists all metrics:

tr.td: This option disables the display of metrics.
None
This metric represents the absolute number of clones found in the given file or directory.
This metric is rolled up by summing the number of clones.
This metric represents the absolute number of clone classes found in the given file or directory.
This metric is rolled up by determining the number of elements contained in the union of all clone classes.
This metric represents the absolute number of lines that are contained in at least one clone. In other words, the number of lines that are duplicated somewhere else.
This metric is rolled up by summing the number of cloned lines.
This metric represents the absolute number of lines contained in the given file or directory. Also called Lines of Code (LoC).
This metric is rolled up by summing the number of lines.

This metric is rolled up by this formula:
[Rolled-up Number of Cloned Lines] / [Rolled-up Number of Lines]

note.p: Files and directories for which no value is displayed have a value of zero. This makes reading much easier as it highlights the hot spots and avoids the impression that you cannot see the forest for the trees.

section.title: Statusbar
section.p: Clone Explorer has a statusbar that indicates the execution status of Clone Detective.

tr.td: Running
Indicates that the clone detection is executing.
Succeeded
Indicates that the clone detection was successful and produced a result.
Error
Indicates that the clone detection could not be performed due to an error. Click the link to review the log file.
Stopped
Indicates that the clone detection was cancelled by the user.
